Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a pale-orange grooved pottery vessel, the fabric is partially pink and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.193)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36469) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36469)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 329 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
